page.title: 19EPPING'S ANTIQUE GALLERIES
page.content: The building of one of Epping's first supermarkets in the early 70's left empty property at the south east of Epping's High Street.This buildingis now the centre of the{Antique trade} in Epping,and houses 20 units.In 1985 Thursday is said to be the slackest day and Saturday the busiest The units are ideal for purchasing antiques, crafts and other products. Each Saturday a{Flea market}is held in an open area behind the building.Many people in Epping and surrounding areas come to bargain hunt.Paintings,maps, wartime souvenirs,dried flowers,lace, silk flowers and many other craft products can be purchased.With the opening of the controversial Tesco store opposite,shoppers will be attracted to this area in greater numbers.Protesters fear traffic problems. Many welcome extra jobs.
